history.proof: unfold is_lub_Rbar, Lub_Rbar. destruct (ex_lub_Rbar E) as [l Hl]. simpl. split. - apply Hl. - intros b Hb. apply Hl. apply Hb.

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
E: R -> Prop

Goal:
is_lub_Rbar E (Lub_Rbar E)

Premises:
*** [ R : Set ]
is_lub_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => is_ub_Rbar E l /\ (forall b : Rbar, is_ub_Rbar E b -> Rbar_le l b) : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
Lub_Rbar = fun E : R -> Prop => proj1_sig (ex_lub_Rbar E) : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar Argument scope is [function_scope]
ex_lub_Rbar : forall E : R -> Prop, {l : Rbar | is_lub_Rbar E l}
is_lub_Rbar_unique : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_lub_Rbar E l -> Lub_Rbar E = l
is_glb_Rbar_opp : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_lub_Rbar E l < -> is_glb_Rbar (fun x : R => E (- x)) (Rbar_opp l)
is_lub_Rbar_opp : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_glb_Rbar E l < -> is_lub_Rbar (fun x : R => E (- x)) (Rbar_opp l)
completeness : forall E : R -> Prop, bound E -> (exists x : R, E x) -> {m : R | is_lub E m}
is_ub_Rbar_dec : forall E : R -> Prop, {l : R | is_ub_Rbar E l} + {forall l : R, ~ is_ub_Rbar E l}
bound = fun E : R -> Prop => exists m : R, is_upper_bound E m : (R -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
is_lub = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => is_upper_bound E m /\ (forall b : R, is_upper_bound E b -> m <= b) : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
is_ub_Rbar_opp : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_lb_Rbar E l < -> is_ub_Rbar (fun x : R => E (- x)) (Rbar_opp l)
is_lb_Rbar_opp : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_ub_Rbar E l < -> is_lb_Rbar (fun x : R => E (- x)) (Rbar_opp l)
is_glb_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => is_lb_Rbar E l /\ (forall b : Rbar, is_lb_Rbar E b -> Rbar_le b l) : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_upper_bound = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => forall x : R, E x -> x <= m : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
is_lb_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => forall x : R, E x -> Rbar_le l x : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_ub_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => forall x : R, E x -> Rbar_le x l : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
FEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> FExpr C -> R
pow_N : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> R -> N -> R
PCond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
pow_pos : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> R -> positive -> R
limit1_in = fun (f : R -> R) (D : R -> Prop) (l x0 : R) => limit_in R_met R_met f D x0 l : (R -> R) -> (R -> Prop) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope R_scope R_scope]
div_fct = fun (f1 f2 : R -> R) (x : R) => f1 x / f2 x : (R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope Rfun_scope R_scope]
mult_fct = fun (f1 f2 : R -> R) (x : R) => f1 x * f2 x : (R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope Rfun_scope R_scope]
inv_fct = fun (f : R -> R) (x : R) => / f x : (R -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope]
mkpow_th : forall (R : Type) (rI : R) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (Cpow : Type) (Cp_phi : N -> Cpow) (rpow : R -> Cpow -> R), (forall (r : R) (n : N), req (rpow r (Cp_phi n)) (pow_N rI rmul r n)) -> power_theory rI rmul req Cp_phi rpow
*** [ Rmult : R -> R -> R ] Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
*** [ Rplus : R -> R -> R ] Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
R_dist = fun x y : R => Rabs (x - y) : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rdiv = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 * / r2 : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rminus = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 + - r2 : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
*** [ Rlt : R -> R -> Prop ] Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
continuity_pt = fun (f : R -> R) (x0 : R) => continue_in f no_cond x0 : (R -> R) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope]

```coq
unfold is_lub_Rbar, Lub_Rbar.
destruct (ex_lub_Rbar E) as [l Hl].
simpl. split.
- apply Hl.
- intros b Hb. apply Hl. exact Hb.
Qed.
```
